channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10594] Speed up TestRestoreSnapshotFromClient
item.description: Looking through the longest running test in 0.94 I noticed that TestRestoreSnapshotFromClient runs for over 10 minutes on the jenkins boxes (264s on my local box).

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Trivial change. The observation is that snapshot1 is only used in one of the tests, but yet it is re-created for every single test.
Shave 10% of the runtime (i.e. 1 minute on the jenkinds boxes).

Not important, but might not hurt either.
Trunk patch.
Committed to all branches. Thanks Matteo.

Ever since this was committed almost all tests started timing out. I can't see how this is causing it, but I'll revert this change just to be sure.
Hmm... 0.98 and trunk test runs passed after all. So probably not this. Leaving open until I see at least one 0.94 go through.
It's still funky. Reverting now.
Reverted from all branches. I have no time to investigate why this caused this test to time out frequently.

TestRestoreSnapshotFromClient is still timing out every now and then. So not related to this.
Will investigate a bit more and then reapply.

I also have a patch that streamlines SnapshotTestingUtils a bit (just trivial changes) to the the number of splits can be changed easily. When I dial that back from 16 to 9 regions this test speeds up 40% (not too surprisingly).
Here it is. Parking patch here, will make a trunk patch later for a test run.
Updated patch for trunk. Matteo Bertozzi, mind having another look?

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12632782/10594-trunk-v2.txt
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12632782

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8892//testReport/

Committed to all branches again. Thanks for taking a look Matteo Bertozzi.
